intro: Valerianella laticuspis, commonly known as broad-lobed valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features basal leaves that are broadly ovate to kidney-shaped with toothed margins. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its flowering stems are usually unbranched and bear a dense inflorescence. Valerianella laticuspis is often found in moist meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
